text:
F. H. LaGUARDIA, Mayor
M. S. NOVIK, Director
CITY OF NEW YORK
MUNICIPAL BROADCASTING SYSTEM
MUNICIPAL BUILDING
WORTH 2-5600
WNYC
And
Stations
WASJ
WKDX
W2XRG
W2XVP
WNYK
WNYL
WNYN
WNYO
January 19th, 1940
Mr. Prank E. Schooley
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
Station WILL
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
My dear Schooley;
I am enclosing the original of the letter
I have just received in connection with the RCA matter. We
got pretty near everything we wanted, and I hope it will he of help
to all of the members of the 1IAEB. Please feel free to make
any copies you want for distribution.
Have you received a letter from Neville Miller
about granting a license to the non-commercial stations for
$1.00 per year? How do you feel about it and what’s your
attitude? I have enclosed a copy of the letter we received.
Very sincerely yours,
ILUjL,
Director
MSN; c
2 enc.
NEW YORK
WORLD'S FAIR 1939
‘New York City’s Own Station”—810 Kc.
